questions.question: This is …………………………. than that.
questions.description: Use a comparative adjective before than.

questions.question: He is the …………………………. boy in the class.
These days, I am …………………………… than I used to be.
questions.description: Use a comparative adjective before than.

questions.question: He is the …………………………… man in my village.
questions.description: The superlative is used to compare one person or thing to the whole group to which they/it belong(s).

questions.question: She looks …………………………… than she is.
questions.description: Use a comparative adjective before than.

questions.question: This is as ………………………….. as that.
questions.description: Use a positive adjective in the structure as... as....

questions.question: You are no …………………………… than him.
questions.description: Use a comparative expression before than.

questions.question: It is no ………………………….
questions.description: When there is no idea of comparison, use the positive adjective.

questions.question: How is your grandmother today? Is she any ……………………………?
questions.description: When change is implied, use the comparative form.
